content: The **[Foreign Sports Talent Scheme](/wiki/Foreign_Sports_Talent_Scheme)** is used by sports officials and organizations in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) to scout and facilitate the migration of non-Singaporeans deemed to possess sports talent to play in Singapore colours in sporting events. Introduced in 1993 by the Singapore Table Tennis Association, it also aimed to boost local sporting standards by importing sporting expertise. In March 2008, it was announced in the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) that 54 athletes had benefited from the programme and received [Singapore citizenship](/wiki/Singaporean_nationality_law), of which 37 were still in active training. ## Athletics -
